intro: Agarista oleifolia var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth agarista, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
